channel.title: This shouldent be hard to answer
channel.description: this isnt a very programmy question but, in a batch file, how do i make it so i can type i letter or number and it will bring me to the correct comand for that number... so im making a file renamer. simple but i want to make it so i can hit 1 to rename .jad to .java and so on thanks... zach

item.title: This shouldent be hard to answer
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:19, topic:434116”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=536833.msg3926246#msg3926246 date=1330241156]
I’m 99% sure what he wants is:

[tt]
Enter a number to rename files:

  1. Jar to Java
  2. PNG to GIF
  3. EXE to Class
    [/tt]
    So when they hit the number it calls the rename command with the proper arguments

As to why he’d want this, I have no clue. Either way it’s very poorly worded.
[/quote]
but those formats aren’t even the same… i hate the fact windows uses file extensions to identify the type of a file, it makes people think that by changing the extension, you’ve somehow magically converted between formats.[/quote]I know, that’s why I said I wasn’t sure why he wanted it

Read full topic

[quote=“Davidi2, post:15, topic:434116”]I’m 99% sure what he wants is:

[tt]
Enter a number to rename files:

  1. Jar to Java
  2. PNG to GIF
  3. EXE to Class
    [/tt]
    So when they hit the number it calls the rename command with the proper arguments

As to why he’d want this, I have no clue. Either way it’s very poorly worded.[/quote]
but those formats aren’t even the same… i hate the fact windows uses file extensions to identify the type of a file, it makes people think that by changing the extension, you’ve somehow magically converted between formats.

item.title: This shouldent be hard to answer
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

then I guess

@echo off
title Choice by Kolton

1. Jar to Java
2. PNG to GIF
3. EXE to Class

choice /n /c 123 /t 5 /d 1 /m Pick:
if errorlevel 1 goto 1
if errorlevel 2 goto 2
if errorlevel 3 goto 3

:1
cls
ren *.jar *.java
exit

:2
cls
ren *.png *gif
exit

:3
cls
ren *.exe *.class

item.title: This shouldent be hard to answer
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Like t4 said, use System.in and create a Java program that mainly consists of a while loop with conditional statements for each specific command (like a damn private server).

Is this what you’re looking for? I found this off a website.

  File old = new File(OLD_ARGS_PATH_WHATEVER);
  File new = new File(NEW_ARGS_PATH_WHATEVER);
  boolean success = old.renameTo(new);

Read full topic

item.title: This shouldent be hard to answer
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

Found this off YouTube.

@echo off
Title File Renamer
cls
:Start1
cls
set /p FN=Type the name of the foler you would like to to rename (enter MF to make a foler):

IF '%FN%' == 'MF' GOTO MF
IF '%FN%' == 'mf' GOTO MF


IF NOT EXIST %FN% Goto error1.



:Start 2
cls
set /p NN=Type the new file name:

IF EXIST %NN% Goto error2

ren %FN% %NN%
echo %FN% renamed to %NN% successfuly
pause
Exit

:MF
cls
set /p NFN=Type the folder name of the folder you would like to make:
MD %NFN%
echo You will be directe to the beginning.
pause
Goto Start1

:error1
cls
echo Sorry! That file does not exixt please try again. (Remember to put the file extensions in! eg .txt,.exe,.bat,.doc!).
Pause
Goto Start1

:error2
cls
echo Sorry! a file with that name already exists! Please try again!
Goto Start2

exit

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Found this on google search mr.

[code]@echo off
title Choice by Kolton

echo 1. pick me
echo 2. no, pick me
echo 3. im the best, pick me

choice /n /c 123 /t 5 /d 1 /m Pick:
if errorlevel 1 goto 1
if errorlevel 2 goto 2
if errorlevel 3 goto 3

:1
cls
echo You picked 3
pause
exit

:2
cls
echo You picked 3
pause
exit

:3
cls
echo You picked 3
pause[/code]
